N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.41 - Executive order no. 41: establishing a task force to analyze federal welfare reform

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the federal government has enacted federal welfare
reform legislation entitled the "Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity

Reconciliation Act of 1996"; WHEREAS, this legislation represents an historic
opportunity to restructure a failed welfare system which has become a way of
life for too many New Yorkers; WHEREAS, welfare should instead be a transitional means of
support for needy New Yorkers; WHEREAS, however, the State of New York may be adversely
affected by the shifting of costs of Medicaid and health care from the federal
government to state and local governments under this legislation. NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby create the Task Force to Analyze

Federal Welfare Reform (the "Task Force"). The Task Force shall be chaired by
the Director of the Division of the Budget and shall include the Commissioners
of Social Services, Health and Labor; the Director of State Operations; the

Temporary President and Majority Leader of the Senate, the Speaker of the

Assembly, the Minority Leader of the Senate and the Minority Leader of the

Assembly, or their designees; the Mayor of the City of New York or his
designee; and a member designated by the New York State Association of

Counties. 1. The Task Force shall: a. Review and analyze the policy and fiscal
implications for the State of New York of Federal welfare legislation, entitled
"Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996", specifically including the shifting of medicaid and health care costs from the

Federal government to the State and local-governments; and
b. Through the Chairman, present to the

Governor recommendations for any legislative or regulatory changes necessary to
comply with and implement Federal welfare legislation in the best interests of
all New Yorkers. 2. The
members of the Task Force shall receive no compensation but shall be entitled
to reimbursement for any necessary expenses incurred in connection with the
performance of their duties. 3. Every state department, agency, division, board, bureau, commission, and any
other entity over which I have executive power shall provide any assistance
necessary for the Task Force to carry out its duties. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: August 7, 1996
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
